values:
What American accent do you have?
Created by Xavier on Memegen.net

Western. Like Midland, Western is another accent that people consider neutral. So, you might not actually be from the Western half of the country, but you definitely sound like it.

And if you're not from the West, you are probably one of the following:
(a) A Pittsburgher - the quiz can't tell the difference;
(b) Someone from Canada (probably southern Ontario) who doesn't have a Canadian accent;
(c) Someone from northern New England who doesn't have a New England accent; or
(d) Someone from Texas or the Heartland who was born after 1980.
You are definitely not from New York, New Jersey, Chicago, Detroit, the Deep South, etc.</font>

Take this quiz now - it's easy!
We're going to start with "cot" and "caught." When you say those words do they sound the same or different?

EDIT: Here is what Jameson looked like in 2006: And here is what she looked like at the Oscars in 2007: (Click on either image for a larger version. Thanks to for drawing my attention to her appearance at the Oscars.) My gf and I were watching some porn last night. I'd actually never seen Jenna Jameson in porn before, so I got a DVD that had sex scenes from a bunch of her movies. Honestly, I was kind of disappointed. Her boobs seem INCREDIBLY fake. And she certainly seemed into what she was doing, but not in a way that was anything special for a porn star. In the ones I saw, she looked very young and had a girlish voice, so maybe some guys are really into that, but it didn't do much for me. But I know she's immensely popular. What do other people think of Jenna Jameson?

Ganked from :
Intelligence


Intelligence is most important in a boyfriend/girlfriend. You like to be able to talk about everything that is on your mind, and if your partner can't keep up, well, you know. You are very attracted to someone who can challenge you, and make you see things in a whole new way.


Take this quiz at QuizGalaxy.com

I've noticed something on dating sites that surprises me a little. I hope I'm not being TOO narrow minded, but I find it odd that there are so many women who are in their 40s (their early 40s, admittedly) who say they don't want to date any guys not interested in having kids. And by "having kids" I don't mean becoming a stepfather to the kids they already have; I mean they only want guys who are interested in helping them to conceive their first children. I know this is hardly biologically impossible. My mom had me when she was 46. But I was the fifth of five kids, and she'd been married for twenty years by then. And it's not like I object to it, or anything. I just find it surprising that so many women have decided in their early 40s that they NEED to have kids. So suppose you're 41 and you meet the man of your dreams this week. You date for at least a year before getting married (I hope). Now you're 42. With a bit of luck, you'll deliver by the time you're...43?
http://peterspecker.livejournal.com/13436.html

I wish I were in a relationship right now.

I was in one, but it didn't work out.  

The stereotype is that men just want fucks, while women want relationships, but sometimes women are the ones who are afraid of the emotional intimacy.  

And that sucks too.

I still love you, Marissa.

Damn you.
http://peterspecker.livejournal.com/12024.html

Scarlett Johansson: She can convey so much while saying so little. Patrick Stewart: You know you want him! (Here he is with his girlfriend. And I assumed he was gay!) Kate Winslet: I think I might marry someone like "Clementine" (on the left). That's not a boast, I just think that's the sort of person who could be attracted to me, and I would want back. (Don't you think?) Al Pacino: Cause he's Al-Fucking-Pacino, that's why! Tina Fey and Jimmy Fallon: Sometimes you get a two-fer. Frankly, I'd do either one of 'em! Martha Nussbaum: Yeah, well she's never heard of YOU either! If you read one of her books, like Love's Knowledge, and you don't want to do her afterwards, you're a shallow pig. Tony Leung Chiu-Wai: Just a reminder of how much Chinese men can rock-out-loud: Alanis Morissette: Yeah, I know not everyone finds her attractive or loves her music. I do both. So screw you. Bill Murray: I am him. (Actually, I kind of look like him in this shot, don't you think? C'mon! Just a little?) "I was caddying for the Dali Lama, and when we were done he said he didn't have any money to tip me, but he did promise that on my deathbed I would achieve total Enlightenment. So, y'know, I got that going for me." Zhang Ziyi: Or Ziyi Zhang. Either way, she's too hot for words. Daniel Patrick Moynihan: I tried to think of a living man who's sexy for his mind or his achievements. Couldn't come up with one. The closest I got was Senator Moynihan, professor, ambassador, senator. Unfortunately, he's dead. Kirsten Dunst: Sometimes I can't watch her movies because she's so hot it hurts. (I know that's stupid, but it's true.) Harrison Ford: Oh yeah. He's STILL got it going on! And, last but not least, my Alyson Hannigan and Sarah Michelle Gellar fetishes are well-known to all: Now, tell me whom I was foolish for leaving off the list, or whom I was a fool for including. ;-)
http://peterspecker.livejournal.com/7978.html

I can't sleep. I'm posting smut and humor, but really what's keeping me awake is memories that won't go away...of the woman I'm in love with...and the man she's married to instead of me. I should have forgotten you long ago But you're in every song I know Whining and pining is wrong and so On and so forth, of course of course, But no, you can't have a divorce I haven't seen you in ages But it's not as bleak as it seems We still dance on whirling stages In my Busby Berkeley dreams The tears have stained all the pages Of my True Romance magazines We still dance in my outrageously beautiful Busby Berkeley dreams And now you want to leave me for good I refuse to believe you could You forget we're not made of wood Well darling you may do your worst Because you'll have to kill me first I haven't seen you in ages But it's not as bleak as it seems We still dance on whirling stages In my Busby Berkeley dreams The tears have stained all the pages Of my True Romance magazines We still dance in my outrageously beautiful Busby Berkeley dreams Do you think it's dangerous To have Busby Berkeley dreams? -- "Busby Berkeley Dreams" by Magnetic Fields (from 69 Love Songs)

I'll be back though!
